ref: 12512 śúcyati ʻ is purified, burns, decays ʼ Vop., ʻ rots ʼ Dhātup. (śṓcati, ˚tē ʻ shines ʼ RV., ʻ suffers violent heat or pain, mourns for ʼ TS., ʻ is absorbed in meditation ʼ MW.). [Cf. sáṁśucyati ŚBr. -- √śuc]
Kho. (Lor.) šičik ʻ to become clear ʼ, čičeik tr. ʻ to clear, filter (of liquids) ʼ;
K. hǒċun ʻ to decay, rot ʼ (pp. họ̆tu < śuktá -- );
Ku. sucṇo ʻ to regret, repent ʼ, sucīṇo ʻ to be purified, be absolved ʼ (whence tr. sucyoṇo);
A. xusāiba ʻ to think, consider ʼ;
Or. sucibā ʻ to grieve ʼ, sucāibā ʻ to remind ʼ;
G. sucavvũ ʻ to intimate, hint, inform ʼ;
M. suċṇẽ ʻ to come to mind, arise in one's thought ʼ, sucẽ n. ʻ hint, suggestion ʼ. -- See śōcyatē.
